31namespace ZXing {
32
33static const int LUMINANCE_BITS = 5;
34static const int LUMINANCE_SHIFT = 8 - LUMINANCE_BITS;
35static const int LUMINANCE_BUCKETS = 1 << LUMINANCE_BITS;
36
37
38struct GlobalHistogramBinarizer::DataCache
39{
40 std::once_flag once;
41 std::shared_ptr<const BitMatrix> matrix;
42};
43
44GlobalHistogramBinarizer::GlobalHistogramBinarizer(std::shared_ptr<const LuminanceSource> source) :
45 _source(std::move(source)),
46 _cache(new DataCache)
47{
48}
49
50GlobalHistogramBinarizer::~GlobalHistogramBinarizer() = default;
51
52int
53GlobalHistogramBinarizer::width() const
54{
55 return _source->width();
56}
57
58int
59GlobalHistogramBinarizer::height() const
60{
61 return _source->height();
62}
63
64
65// Return -1 on error
66static int EstimateBlackPoint(const std::array<int, LUMINANCE_BUCKETS>& buckets)
67{
68 // Find the tallest peak in the histogram.
69 auto firstPeakPos = std::max_element(buckets.begin(), buckets.end());
70 int firstPeak = static_cast<int>(firstPeakPos - buckets.begin());
71 int firstPeakSize = *firstPeakPos;
72 int maxBucketCount = firstPeakSize;
73
74 // Find the second-tallest peak which is somewhat far from the tallest peak.
75 int secondPeak = 0;
76 int secondPeakScore = 0;
77 for (int x = 0; x < LUMINANCE_BUCKETS; x++) {
78 int distanceToBiggest = x - firstPeak;
79 // Encourage more distant second peaks by multiplying by square of distance.
80 int score = buckets[x] * distanceToBiggest * distanceToBiggest;
81 if (score > secondPeakScore) {
82 secondPeak = x;
83 secondPeakScore = score;
84 }
85 }
86
87 // Make sure firstPeak corresponds to the black peak.
88 if (firstPeak > secondPeak) {
89 std::swap(firstPeak, secondPeak);
90 }
91
92 // If there is too little contrast in the image to pick a meaningful black point, throw rather
93 // than waste time trying to decode the image, and risk false positives.
94 if (secondPeak - firstPeak <= LUMINANCE_BUCKETS / 16) {
95 return -1;
96 }
97
98 // Find a valley between them that is low and closer to the white peak.
99 int bestValley = secondPeak - 1;
100 int bestValleyScore = -1;
101 for (int x = secondPeak - 1; x > firstPeak; x--) {
102 int fromFirst = x - firstPeak;
103 int score = fromFirst * fromFirst * (secondPeak - x) * (maxBucketCount - buckets[x]);
104 if (score > bestValleyScore) {
105 bestValley = x;
106 bestValleyScore = score;
107 }
108 }
109
110 return bestValley << LUMINANCE_SHIFT;
111}
112
113// Applies simple sharpening to the row data to improve performance of the 1D Readers.
114bool
115GlobalHistogramBinarizer::getBlackRow(int y, BitArray& row) const
116{
117 int width = _source->width();
118 if (width < 3)
119 return false; // special casing the code below for a width < 3 makes no sense
120
121 if (row.size() != width)
122 row = BitArray(width);
123 else
124 row.clearBits();
125
126 ByteArray buffer;
127 const uint8_t* luminances = _source->getRow(y, buffer);
128 std::array<int, LUMINANCE_BUCKETS> buckets = {};
129 for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
130 buckets[luminances[x] >> LUMINANCE_SHIFT]++;
131 }
132 int blackPoint = EstimateBlackPoint(buckets);
133 if (blackPoint <= 0)
134 return false;
135
136 if (luminances[0] < blackPoint)
137 row.set(0);
138
139 int x = 1;
140 for (auto* p = luminances + 1; p < luminances + width - 1; ++p, ++x) {
141 // A simple -1 4 -1 box filter with a weight of 2.
142 if ((-*(p - 1) + (int(*p) * 4) - *(p + 1)) / 2 < blackPoint) {
143 row.set(x);
144 }
145 }
146
147 if (luminances[width - 1] < blackPoint)
148 row.set(width - 1);
149
150 return true;
151}
152
153bool GlobalHistogramBinarizer::getPatternRow(int y, PatternRow& res) const
154{
155 int width = _source->width();
156 if (width < 3)
157 return false; // special casing the code below for a width < 3 makes no sense
158
159 res.clear();
160
161 ByteArray buffer;
162 const uint8_t* luminances = _source->getRow(y, buffer);
163 std::array<int, LUMINANCE_BUCKETS> buckets = {};
164 for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
165 buckets[luminances[x] >> LUMINANCE_SHIFT]++;
166 }
167 int blackPoint = EstimateBlackPoint(buckets);
168 if (blackPoint <= 0)
169 return false;
170
171 auto* lastPos = luminances;
172 bool lastVal = luminances[0] < blackPoint;
173 if (lastVal)
174 res.push_back(0); // first value is number of white pixels, here 0
175
176 auto process = [&](bool val, const uint8_t* p) {
177 if (val != lastVal) {
178 res.push_back(p - lastPos);
179 lastVal = val;
180 lastPos = p;
181 }
182 };
183
184 for (auto* p = luminances + 1; p < luminances + width - 1; ++p)
185 process((-*(p - 1) + (int(*p) * 4) - *(p + 1)) / 2 < blackPoint, p);
186
187 auto* backPos = luminances + width - 1;
188 bool backVal = *backPos < blackPoint;
189 process(backVal, backPos);
190
191 res.push_back(backPos - lastPos + 1);
192
193 if (backVal)
194 res.push_back(0); // last value is number of white pixels, here 0
195
196 assert(res.size() % 2 == 1);
197
198 return true;
199}
200
201static void InitBlackMatrix(const LuminanceSource& source, std::shared_ptr<const BitMatrix>& outMatrix)
202{
203 int width = source.width();
204 int height = source.height();
205 auto matrix = std::make_shared<BitMatrix>(width, height);
206
207 // Quickly calculates the histogram by sampling four rows from the image. This proved to be
208 // more robust on the blackbox tests than sampling a diagonal as we used to do.
209 std::array<int, LUMINANCE_BUCKETS> localBuckets = {};
210 {
211 ByteArray buffer;
212 for (int y = 1; y < 5; y++) {
213 int row = height * y / 5;
214 const uint8_t* luminances = source.getRow(row, buffer);
215 int right = (width * 4) / 5;
216 for (int x = width / 5; x < right; x++) {
217 localBuckets[luminances[x] >> LUMINANCE_SHIFT]++;
218 }
219 }
220 }
221
222 int blackPoint = EstimateBlackPoint(localBuckets);
223 if (blackPoint <= 0)
224 return;
225
226 // We delay reading the entire image luminance until the black point estimation succeeds.
227 // Although we end up reading four rows twice, it is consistent with our motto of
228 // "fail quickly" which is necessary for continuous scanning.
229 ByteArray buffer;
230 int stride;
231 const uint8_t* luminances = source.getMatrix(buffer, stride);
232 for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
233 int offset = y * stride;
234 for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
235 if (luminances[offset + x] < blackPoint) {
236 matrix->set(x, y);
237 }
238 }
239 }
240 outMatrix = matrix;
241}
242
243// Does not sharpen the data, as this call is intended to only be used by 2D Readers.
244std::shared_ptr<const BitMatrix>
245GlobalHistogramBinarizer::getBlackMatrix() const
246{
247 std::call_once(_cache->once, &InitBlackMatrix, std::cref(*_source), std::ref(_cache->matrix));
248 return _cache->matrix;
249}
250
251bool
252GlobalHistogramBinarizer::canCrop() const
253{
254 return _source->canCrop();
255}
256
257std::shared_ptr<BinaryBitmap>
258GlobalHistogramBinarizer::cropped(int left, int top, int width, int height) const
259{
260 return newInstance(_source->cropped(left, top, width, height));
261}
262
263bool
264GlobalHistogramBinarizer::canRotate() const
265{
266 return _source->canRotate();
267}
268
269std::shared_ptr<BinaryBitmap>
270GlobalHistogramBinarizer::rotated(int degreeCW) const
271{
272 return newInstance(_source->rotated(degreeCW));
273}
274
275std::shared_ptr<BinaryBitmap>
276GlobalHistogramBinarizer::newInstance(const std::shared_ptr<const LuminanceSource>& source) const
277{
278 return std::make_shared<GlobalHistogramBinarizer>(source);
279}
